image.altText: Julian Assange, in jeans and collared shirt, walks up a staircase onto a plane

props.synopsis: WikiLeaks says its founder Julian Assange has been released from prison and has left the United Kingdom, shortly after court documents revealed a plea deal that would allow him to return to Australia.

title.children: Julian Assange released from prison and has left UK, WikiLeaks says

image.altText: Officers in forensics uniforms outside a house.

props.synopsis: Police say they are keeping an "open mind" as they investigate whether a drug overdose caused the deaths of four people found in the living room of a home in Melbourne's north this morning.

title.children: Police keeping 'open mind' while investigating four deaths at home in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A small yellow tablet next to a ruler.

props.synopsis: A synthetic opioid — which has been linked to a rise in overdose deaths overseas — has emerged on the illicit drug scene, with some experts warning it has the potential to be Australia's version of a "fentanyl crisis".

title.children: A synthetic opioid stronger than fentanyl and hundreds of times more potent than heroin is emerging in Australia

image.altText: a woman holds a vape as she blows smoke out of her mouth while walking outdoors

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth government's "world-leading" vape ban is expected to come into effect next week, but sudden changes mean they will be easier to buy in October.

title.children: Here's what we know about Australia's move to restrict sale of vapes from next week

image.altText: A man and a woman sit on a chair on a balcony looking at the camera with neutral expressions.

props.synopsis: Ten months after their dream of becoming parents turned to tragedy, these families are still fighting a giant IVF company to find out what went wrong.

title.children: It was the best chance Vikki and Chris had in years to get pregnant. Then the IVF clinic destroyed their embryos

image.altText: A blonde woman in a hospital bed with a young boy in only a nappy who has been intubated.

props.synopsis: Megan Beit hopes the ACT budget's almost $58 million investment in paediatric healthcare will reduce the number of trips to Sydney she takes to receive specialist care for her son Jon, who has spinal muscular atrophy.

title.children: Megan's son Jon has spinal muscular atrophy. His care requires regular long distance travel

image.altText: Badge on the sleeve of Australian Federal Police officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: A 31-year-old man is arrested after two alleged attempted abductions of women in Mawson. Police say he is likely to face court on Tuesday.

title.children: Arrest made after two women claim a man tried to abduct them while out exercising in Canberra

image.altText: A graphic of male and female characters against a wooden background.

props.synopsis: Legal experts want the federal government to foot the bill for child support if an ex-partner doesn't pay, with new data revealing last financial year 168,000 parents had overdue tax returns.

title.children: Parents failing to submit tax returns are skewing child support payments

image.altText: Australian Opposition Leader Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Since the Menzies era, the Liberal Party's mantra has been built on a free market and small government. But Peter Dutton's nuclear power plans mean the opposition's ambitions have turned the party's ideology on its head.

title.children: Dutton's swing to nuclear power heralds a return to nationalisation

image.altText: Adam Bandt

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt confirms the minor party will move a motion to recognise Palestine in the Senate today, after a Labor senator revealed she was considering crossing the floor. Follow live.

title.children: Adam Bandt sets up test for Labor ranks as Fatima Payman considers crossing the floor

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wikileaks posts vision of Julian Assange leaving the UK
Govt releases statement on Julian Assange
PM has long called for Assange's return to Australia

image.altText: A wife and husband outside an Adelaide court.

props.synopsis: Louise Beaston, the wife of ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle, is pleading with the government to look into the criminal prosecution of her husband and fix whistleblowing laws so nobody else is forced to endure what her family has. This case is the latest reminder that Australia's whistleblower laws need urgent reform.

title.children: Richard Boyle's wife has a simple plea for those in power: fix the law so no-one else has to endure what we have

image.altText: A person at a desk with a calculator and lots of receipts in their hand

props.synopsis: About 14 million Australians will be prepping their tax returns over the coming weeks and months come July 1. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: When can I lodge my tax return? Here's the cut-off date to avoid a fine from the ATO

image.altText: Man surfing a wave

props.synopsis: Tamayo Perry, who appeared in the Pirates of the Caribbean series, has died after being attacked by a shark while surfing.

title.children: Pirates of the Caribbean actor and former pro surfer killed in shark attack

image.altText: Holly Willoughby in a dress standing on a red carpet and smiling as fans stand behind a barrier behind her

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old man plotted to abduct, rape and murder one of Britain's most popular TV personalities, Holly Willoughby, a court has been told.

title.children: Man plotted to 'rape and murder' British TV personality

image.altText: A close-up of a smartphone displaying an Nvidia logo, sandwiched between two computer parts.

props.synopsis: Chipmaker Nvidia has seen a drop in its share price for a third session in a row on Wall Street, sending the Nasdaq lower. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 also fell and Dow Jones hit its highest level in a month. Follow live.

title.children: Nvidia slides for third-straight session and takes the Nasdaq with it, as Dow hits one-month high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 rises as Collins Foods surges while Healius sinks
Apple becomes first company charged under new EU competition laws
Qantas snaps up second-hand planes for its QantasLink fleet

image.altText: Donald Trump holding rainbow flag with words 'LGBTs for Trump' written on it.

props.synopsis: It's easy to forget that Donald Trump's entry to politics came via a gay Republican group. The "Gay Right" has played a defining role in conservative US politics for decades.

title.children: Trump promised to protect the LGBTQ community. Now, he's vowing to do the opposite

image.altText: A group of kids holding hands with a teacher.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian troops have started reclaiming territory taken by Russia in the north-east while Kharkiv's residents continue to live under constant threat.

title.children: In Ukraine, soldiers have reversed Russia's fortunes on the battlefield. But civilians are forced to live underground

image.altText: Princess Anne in a vibrant purple jacket with matching scarf and hat

props.synopsis: Princess Anne sustains minor injuries and a concussion following an incident on the Gatcombe Park estate, according to a statement from Buckingham Palace.

title.children: Princess Anne in hospital after sustaining concussion, Buckingham Palace says

image.altText: A composite of Celine Dion photos where she's singing, one very young, one with bright red hair, another in a sparkly dress

props.synopsis: Céline Dion kept her diagnosis with stiff person syndrome a secret from her fans for years. This new documentary offers an unfiltered glimpse at what her life is like now.

title.children: Pain, joy and John Farnham: The most important moments in new doco I Am: Céline Dion

image.altText: A woman holds a vape to her lips and smoke pours from her mouth

props.synopsis: The federal government's deal with the Greens to weaken a vaping ban due to start from next week is "disappointing", leading health officials say, but it will still have a massive impact on the availability of vapes for young people.

title.children: Young people set to be cut off from vaping from next week despite weakened laws, public health officials say

image.altText: WA Parliament question time wide

props.synopsis: WA politicians have recently been promised a pay rise to bring them in line with other states and territories, but some say it's not enough for an "unstable, unforgiving job".

title.children: Why are some politicians abandoning their career and six-figure salary in favour of the private sector?

image.altText: Italy v Croatia

props.synopsis: Italy scores a last-second stunner to damage Croatia's hopes, a Hungarian attacker undergoes surgery, and a Euro stalwart becomes the oldest-ever goalscorer.

title.children: Five quick hits: Italy breaks Croatian hearts with last-second stunner and Hungary offers update on attacker after horror clash

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Marsh after the loss to India

props.synopsis: Australia will require a helping hand from Bangladesh later today in order to qualify for the T20 World Cup semifinals after a heavy loss to India in a crucial Super Eights clash.

title.children: Australia in danger of T20 World Cup exit after 'disappointing' loss to India in crucial clash

image.altText: Spencer Leniu is denied by Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow

props.synopsis: The stakes are high for the second blockbuster in this year's State of Origin series. Here's a breakdown of what you need to know.

title.children: Ready for State of Origin game II? Here's what you need to know ahead of kick-off

image.altText: A giant, stubby-faced kangaroo

props.synopsis: Scientists are piecing together a picture of how Australia's extinct giant kangaroos moved.

title.children: Giant kangaroos once roamed Australia. New fossils suggest they moved more like T. rex than Skippy

image.altText: red seating of cinema

props.synopsis: The historic Regent Cinemas, once the largest "movie palace" in regional Victoria has closed, effective immediately, after almost 100 years of screening films.

title.children: 'Heartbreaking closure' of beloved century-old cinema stuns regional city's moviegoers

image.altText: A landscape view of trees and homes at Whyalla

props.synopsis: With a $593 million hydrogen plant on the way, sales activity in Whyalla's housing market is on average double compared to its regional neighbours.

title.children: Buyers snap up houses sight unseen in rural city set for hydrogen-fuelled future

image.altText: Men standing in burnt down synagogue.

props.synopsis: Gunmen opened fire at churches and synagogues in Russia's Dagestan region on Sunday, killing 20 people and injured over 40 others.

title.children: Death toll rises to 20 after gunmen attack Russia's Dagestan

image.altText: A man concealing his face stands in front of a roadblock and a small fire at night.

props.synopsis: A new wave of unrest has hit New Caledonia amid warnings the decision to send seven activists charged over deadly riots to France has mobilised pro-independence supporters.

title.children: New wave of violence in New Caledonia as activists sent 17,000km away to detention in France

image.altText: Former VFL/AFL players Tony Lockett and Dermot Brereton stand with arms around each others shoulder.

props.synopsis: Some of Australian rules football's most iconic moments surfaced when the league's best pulled on a representative jumper. But in an age of intense injury and performance scrutiny, is there a world where State of Origin could resume?

title.children: What would it take for the AFL to bring back State Of Origin football?

image.altText: a composite photo showing images of dargo and bush nurses.

props.synopsis: Bush nurses are often the first responders to emergencies in remote areas, which means they could be delivering a baby one day, and saving someone's life on the back of a ute the next.

title.children: 'The goanna had a good go at this person's leg': Why bush nurses need to be prepared for just about anything

image.altText: A woman stands in an orchard, holding a basket full of white flowers.

props.synopsis: While elderberry can be found in everything from cordial to cosmetics around the globe, in Australia its health benefits and potential are only just beginning to be realised.

title.children: You may not have heard of this berry, but these Victorian farmers are determined to change that
